1.question: What is the basis for pricing company services?

3.question: What are the required documents when signing the contract?
3.answer:
The required documents are:

• Civil engineer's plan.

• Area plan.

• Property ownership certificate for the real estate project or exploitation authorization.

• Building permit (or approval summary for the plans you submit).

• Commercial registry and articles of association if the project owner is a legal entity (company).

• National ID card or passport if the project owner is an individual.

• Inheritance record.

• Insurance certificate for the construction site.

firstPart.description: Companies are divided according to the nature of their work into civil companies and commercial companies. Commercial companies are further divided according to their basis on personal or financial considerations into partnerships, capital companies, and companies of mixed nature. Only commercial companies acquire merchant status, bear the obligations arising from this status, and are subject to bankruptcy laws when they stop paying their commercial debts. Civil companies can take one of the forms specific to commercial companies, such as being established as a partnership, limited partnership, limited partnership with shares, joint stock company, or limited liability company. In this file, we provide you with details on establishing a limited liability company in the Kingdom of Morocco.
features: Processing registration procedures for the articles of incorporation and domiciliation.
Commercial registry readiness within two weeks.
Conducting comprehensive feasibility studies for company operations.

secondPart.title: General
secondPart.description: A limited liability company, abbreviated as LLC in the Kingdom of Morocco. In some countries it is abbreviated as Ltd. In French: SOCIÉTÉ À RESPONSABILITÉ LIMITÉE SARL, which means: a company consisting of two or more persons, where the partner's liability for its debts, obligations, and losses is limited to the amount of their share in its capital. The partner's share is transferred upon death to their heirs or those they recommend for any share. The number of partners in this company does not exceed fifty partners.

stepsSection.title: Steps we follow to establish a limited liability company

1.title: Obtaining a negative certificate
1.description: This is the first step in establishing a company in Morocco, which involves obtaining a negative certificate that confirms that there is no similar name to the proposed company name within two months. This certificate is valid for six months.

2.title: Working on the domiciliation or lease contract
2.description: Lease contract, domiciliation contract, property ownership, or proof of building purchase where the main objective is to clarify the company's address and prove the company's right to use the property for commercial activities.

3.title: Establishing the company's articles of association
3.description: Establishing the articles of association specific to a limited liability company in Morocco, obtaining partner signatures, defining the scope of work, and determining capital and shares for each partner.

4.title: Opening a bank account with capital deposit
4.description: Opening a temporary bank account to deposit capital, and upon completion of company establishment procedures, the temporary bank account is converted to a regular company account.

5.title: Registration for property tax and tax identifier
5.description: Registration for property tax and obtaining the company's tax identifier, which is necessary to begin the company's legal and financial activities.

6.title: Required documents for establishing a limited liability company in Morocco
6.description: Collecting all required documents according to Moroccan law to ensure smooth establishment process in compliance with legal requirements.

7.title: Registration in the commercial registry
7.description: The company is registered in the commercial registry, which is the official record that legally proves the company's existence and gives it the right to conduct commercial activities.

8.title: Affiliation with the National Social Security Fund in Morocco
8.description: Registering the company and employees with the National Social Security Fund to ensure social protection and compliance with Moroccan labor laws.

9.title: Official forms
9.description: Preparing and printing all official company forms such as the official seal, correspondence, and all necessary documents to start operations.

We also share your personal data with other external parties when necessary in order to comply with a legal obligation when we believe in good faith that there is a legal justification, or in response to a request from government agencies conducting investigations, or to verify the validity of our applicable policies or save them, or to monitor fraudulent activities and be wary of them or any technical or security vulnerabilities, or to respond to an emergency, or to protect the rights, property, safety or security of third parties or visitors to our website or our business or the general public.

We do not sell your personal data. However, when your personal data is disclosed to any third party that is not a partner or ally of the Company, or to an external service provider, we are committed to obtaining the person's consent, except as required or permitted by law. Only the necessary amount of information is provided to that party under the prevailing circumstances, and the use of personal data for purposes other than the intended purpose is prohibited.

dataTransferAbroad.title: Is Your Personal Data Transferred Outside the Country?
dataTransferAbroad.content: If the external service provider is located in a foreign country, your personal data may be processed and stored in that country. In these circumstances, governments, courts, law enforcement authorities or regulatory bodies in that foreign country may be able to access your data under their applicable laws, however, we will verify when transferring your personal data to a foreign country, that appropriate safeguards are applied in that transfer.

howWeProtectData.title: How Does the Company Protect Your Personal Data
howWeProtectData.content: The nature of protective measures varies according to the sensitivity of personal data, its scope and how it is stored. The most sensitive types of personal information are surrounded by higher levels of protection, such as encryption. If you would like more information about the protective measures applied by us, please contact us via email contact@karihomeco.com.

dataRetentionPeriod.title: What is the Company's Personal Data Retention Period?
dataRetentionPeriod.content:
The Company will retain the collected personal data in accordance with applicable legal requirements.

Personal data is automatically deleted if it is no longer required and there is no legal justification that requires retaining it.

yourRights.title: What Are Your Rights?
yourRights.content:
When it comes to your personal data, the law preserves a number of rights for you. You can get more information and advice about your rights from the data protection authority in your country, and your rights include the following:

Right to object to data processing: You have the right to object to certain types of data processing, including processing for direct marketing purposes (if you no longer wish to receive messages about potential opportunities, for example).
Right to be informed: You have the right to obtain clear, transparent and easy-to-understand information about how we use your information and your rights. This is why we provide you with information in this policy.
Right to access your information: You have the right to access your information (if we are processing it) and some other information (similar to the information contained in this privacy policy), in order to review and ensure our use of your personal data in accordance with data protection law.
Right to correct information: You have the right to correct your information if it is inaccurate or incomplete.
Right to erase information: Also known as 'the right to be forgotten', in other words, you may demand the deletion or removal of your information when there is no compelling reason for us to continue using it. This right is not a general right and there are exceptions.
Right to restrict data processing: You have the right to 'block' or be strict about using your information for an additional period. When preventing the processing of your information, we can continue to store it provided we do not use it again. We maintain lists of individuals who have requested to 'stop' processing their information to ensure we respect their request in the future.
Right to data portability: You have the right to obtain your personal data and reuse it for your own purposes in different activities. If you decide to switch, for example, to a new provider, this right allows you to transfer, copy or convert your information effortlessly from our systems to their information technology systems safely and without negatively affecting its usability.
Right to file a complaint: You have the right to file a complaint with the relevant data protection authority in your country about how we handle or process your personal information.
You can exercise any of the rights mentioned above by directing a request to the email: contact@karihomeco.com.

The Company may not be able in certain circumstances to provide access to all the personal data it holds, when disclosure, for example, leads to the disclosure of confidential business information, or if the personal information is subject to a confidentiality condition between the customer and the lawyer, or if that information was collected during an investigation into a contractual breach or legal violation.

complaintsAndSuggestions.title: How Can I Object to Compliance and Make Suggestions?
complaintsAndSuggestions.content:
You can direct your questions or inquiries to the email contact@karihomeco.com about the privacy principles mentioned above or about the privacy practices applied by the Company and mentioned in the privacy policy.

The Company will investigate all complaints and answer all your questions. If it turns out that the complaint is based on grounds, the Company will take appropriate measures to settle it, which may extend to amending its policies and procedures.

yourRoleInProtection.title: Your Role in Protecting Your Personal Data
yourRoleInProtection.content:
Please remember that IKHWA DIGITAL's privacy policy and use of your personal data applies only to information provided by you. We would like to warn you when you disclose personal information, or sensitive privacy data while using chat rooms or news groups, or bulletin boards or other public forums online, that the collection of such information is not done by or for the Company, but may be collected and used by other people or companies over which the Company has no authority. The Company is not responsible for privacy data or privacy compliance, or any other content that appears on any website that is not owned and operated by the Company or its allied companies.

We would like to confirm that the Company makes every effort to protect and safeguard personal information, and we advise that there are protective measures that you must also follow. We recommend not sharing your personal information with any third party unless you are clearly aware of the purpose of their request, and know who you are dealing with. Do not keep sensitive personal information in your email inbox or on webmail.

policyUpdates.title: Updating This Privacy Policy
policyUpdates.content: The Company will update this privacy policy to add any changes that occur to our practices, and in order to comply with applicable laws, and the Company may modify or remove parts of this privacy policy whenever it deems it necessary to do so. When we make any changes to this privacy policy, we will notify you of that. You can check the last update of this privacy policy by referring to the date shown at the top of the first page.
